image.altText: a male politician wearing a suit and tie with an indigenous print

props.synopsis: Leaked documents have revealed the NT government tried to silence doctors speaking out against its tough new crime and alcohol polices at a national medicine conference being held in Darwin. It follows the health minister pulling out from speaking at the event.

title.children: NT government moves to gag protests at national doctors' conference in Darwin

image.altText: Red brick buildings surrounded by high black fences.

props.synopsis: The LNP's plan to mandate education within youth detention if elected has been met with doubt as the sector continues to struggle through staff shortages.

title.children: LNP has pledged to reform youth detention. But a criminologist says there are flaws in the plan

image.altText: Barbed wire and a high fence pictured against a sunset

props.synopsis: Overcrowding forces dozens of prisoners at two of Perth's largest jails to sleep on mattresses on the floor in "Dickensian" conditions.

title.children: Bed shortages force prisoners to sleep on mattresses on floors of Perth's jails, as fears of rising tensions grow

image.altText: A side profile of an Indigenous woman with a painted face.

props.synopsis: Arthurina Moreen's desire was so great to play footy, she'd practice by kicking bottles with her bare feet. A new documentary has shone a light on her resilience, and that of three other Tiwi Islander women as they chase AFLW stardom.

title.children: 'I started by kicking bottles': Documentary follows young Indigenous women chasing AFLW dreams

image.altText: Farmer standing in a field with a phone.

props.synopsis: There are concerns thousands of phones, medical devices, mobile phone boosters in cars, location devices in trucks and farm equipment may stop working.

title.children: The 3G network is about to shut down for good, so what will stop working from Monday?

image.altText: Girl wearing violet dress and white paint holding stick in a forest.

props.synopsis: A recent report has called for a new First Nations tourism body. Those on the ground know the challenges faced by budding business owners.

title.children: A conversation with elders sparked an idea to share culture with visitors, but not without its challenges

image.altText: A teenage girl looks at her phone.

props.synopsis: The NT has joined Queensland and NSW in enacting posting and boasting laws but experts worry the changes will not reduce crime, while disproportionately targeting Indigenous youth.

title.children: NT joins youth crime social media crackdown, but a Darwin dad says the new laws miss the point

image.altText: Matt Wright walks out of court holding his wife's hand as a press pack surrounds the couple.

props.synopsis: Wild Croc Territory star Matt Wright fronted court in Darwin on Thursday alongside his wife, Kaia Wright, ahead of a highly-anticipated jury trial in 2025.

title.children: Netflix star Matt Wright faces pre-trial hearing in NT Supreme Court ahead of 2025 jury trial

image.altText: Anna Torv as Emily Lawson wearing a cowboy hat outside on dry land, behind a fence

props.synopsis: Generational clashes threaten to tear apart a family dynasty in Netflix's Territory, set in Australia's Northern Territory.

title.children: Netflix's Territory zeroes in on dysfunctional family dynasty

image.altText: Beyonce wears a black cowboy hat, leather jacket and sunglasses while standing on a stage.

props.synopsis: In a country without compulsory voting, it's not enough for candidates to convince Americans they're the best option: they also need to get out the vote. Donald Trump and Kamala Harris are trying different strategies to do so.

title.children: What Harris's Beyoncé moment and Trump's Maccas pitstop tell us about their election strategies

image.altText: Adam Bray, right, and Zach Bray who died in the hunter bus crash of June 11, 2023

props.synopsis: The father of a man killed in the crash is leading a class action against Transport for NSW, in which claim documents suggest the roundabout's "tightening radius" contributed to the tragedy.

title.children: Roundabout design and 'inadequate' signage key to Hunter Valley bus crash victims' class action

image.altText: A render of a ship's cabin with large rectangular porthole, beige couch and dog bed.

props.synopsis: Tasmania finds itself in a farcical position where the brand-new Spirit of Tasmania ferries it purchased may end up being hand-me-downs by the time they reach the state's shores.

title.children: Tasmanians will have to sit back and watch someone else use their $850m brand-new Spirit ferries

image.altText: A massive pile of cannabis on fire

props.synopsis: More than 6,500 cannabis plants have been seized in the Gippsland region and burned in what police say is one of the biggest hauls in recent time.

title.children: Police seize $26 million illegal cannabis crop in country Victoria

image.altText: A cache of drugs in foil

props.synopsis: Two US nationals have been given lengthy jail terms for a plot to import cocaine and methamphetamine in shipping containers.

title.children: 'Highest level of drug offending': Couple jailed over one of the biggest drug plots foiled by Australian police

image.altText: A composite image of Erik Menendez and Lyle Menendez as middle-aged men

props.synopsis: Erik and Lyle Menendez could be re-sentenced more than 35 years after killing their parents, a move that could be the first step towards their release.

title.children: Menendez family 'united' in hopes for release after new evidence emerges in 1989 case

image.altText: Erik and Lyle Menendez highlighted in the background of Mark Jackson's 1990 NBA basketball card.

props.synopsis: Almost three decades after they killed their parents, the Menendez brothers were found in the background of an NBA collectors card.

title.children: 'It was like a light bulb': The moment a true crime fan found the Menendez brothers in the background of a basketball card

image.altText: An AI image of a man in a radio station

props.synopsis: One of Poland's leading state broadcasters has come under fire after it launched a new radio program presented solely by artificial intelligence (AI) presenters, weeks after dismissing dozens of creators.

title.children: This Polish radio station dismissed its presenters and turned to AI. Then they interviewed a dead poet

image.altText: A side profile of an Indigenous woman with a painted face.

props.synopsis: Arthurina Moreen's desire was so great to play footy, she'd practice by kicking bottles with her bare feet. A new documentary has shone a light on her resilience, and that of three other Tiwi Islander women as they chase AFLW stardom.

title.children: 'I started by kicking bottles': Documentary follows young Indigenous women chasing AFLW dreams

image.altText: A yellow metal bar gate with the nuclear symbol on it

props.synopsis: Taiwan is months away from phasing out its last nuclear plant, and while some are happy, others question how the tech powerhouse will power itself.

title.children: Taiwan's only months away from shutting off all nuclear power, but some question whether the tech powerhouse is ready

image.altText: A screengrab of a webpage showing flights over the Middle East.

props.synopsis: As Israel and Iran trade blows in the Middle East, commercial aircraft traversing the region are doing so through fewer corridors to avoid getting caught in the crossfire.

title.children: Missiles flying between Israel and Iran have the aviation industry concerned about getting caught in the crossfire

image.altText: truck into house

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to reports a truck veered from the road and crashed into a house on the Princes Highway just after 7am. A man and woman in their 80s inside the house died at the scene.

title.children: Two people killed in bedroom of their home after truck veers off highway in Victoria's south-west

image.altText: A hand holding up a burger with cheese, pickles, tomato sauce and beef inside it.

props.synopsis: The lawsuit alleges that the Colorado man ate food from a McDonald's in Colorado and then tested positive for E coli a few days later.

title.children: US man sues McDonald's after testing positive for E coli

image.altText: Close-up of moldy bread slices, showcasing the detailed texture and various colors of mold growth on the surface.

props.synopsis: Have you ever been tempted to cut off a mouldy corner of cheese? You might be throwing together a last-minute meal and trying to avoid a trip to the shops. Maybe one of your parents would insist it was "still good". But is it?

title.children: Tempted to cut mould off cheese or scrape some off jam? Here's what the experts have to say about it

image.altText: Biden speaks in close up with his skin looking slightly orange

props.synopsis: More than 180,000 Native American children removed from their families and sent to boarding schools where they allege extensive abuse will receive an apology from the US president.

title.children: Biden to make formal apology to Native Americans for child removal policies

image.altText: A man crosses a flooded rice field during rains.

props.synopsis: Tropical Storm Trami kills dozens of people and forces more than 150,000 to flee their homes in the Philippines, according to local officials.

title.children: Over 150,000 driven from homes, 26 dead after Tropical Storm Trami rips through Philippines

image.altText: A half broken bridge on a river after it collapsed during floods

props.synopsis: As one of the deadliest typhoons in decades ripped through Vietnam, a harrowing video of a bridge collapsing emerged on social media. And while the storm dealt the final blow to the bridge, it may not be the only thing responsible for the tragedy.

title.children: The sand mines, the typhoon and the deadly bridge collapse

image.altText: Lucy Letby appears by video link during an appeal against her conviction

props.synopsis: Letby, 34, is serving multiple life sentences with no chance of release after being convicted of murdering seven babies during shifts as a nurse in a British hospital.

title.children: British killer nurse Lucy Letby loses appeal bid for latest murder conviction

image.altText: A batter walking off the ground, with his head down, as the opposition huddle in the background celebrating the wicket

props.synopsis: Western Australia have lost an incredible 8-1 — with their one run coming from a wide — in a batting collapse that has left their One-Day Cup defence in tatters.

title.children: One-day champions WA suffer horror 8-1 batting collapse on home turf, bowled out for 53

image.altText: David Warner holds his bat up to the crowd as he leaves the field

props.synopsis: Letters of reference from current and former Australia captains, as well as coach Andrew McDonald and New Zealand great Kane Williamson help convince a Cricket Australia panel to end David Warner's ban on holding leadership positions, dating back to the 2018 ball-tampering saga.

title.children: Warner's 'Sandpaper-gate' lifetime ban ended after Cummins, Chappell, Sthalekar go in to bat for him

image.altText: A man wearing glasses is shown surrounded journalists holding phones

props.synopsis: Investigators allege more than $6.8 billion was stolen from the fund and laundered by Najib Razak's associates to finance Hollywood films and extravagant purchases.

title.children: Corrupt Malaysian leader says sorry for looting of state investment fund — while reiterating innocence

image.altText: Tim Heath sitting in an office.

props.synopsis: Australian billionaire Tim Heath survived a kidnapping attempt by fighting off his alleged abductors who had pretended to be tradies painting the hallway of his apartment building.

title.children: Australian billionaire Tim Heath fights off alleged abductors dressed as painters in his apartment building

image.altText: Zahra Newman in character as Eve from the Bible holding a red apple with a grimace

props.synopsis: Described as "a musical feast celebrating the women who refused to behave", Well-Behaved Women imagines what some prominent women might say if they sang their thoughts.

title.children: From Eve to Julia Gillard, here are some of the 'well-behaved' women featured at the Belvoir

image.altText: A woman in military attire lying on her side looking pensive

props.synopsis: Lee Miller was a model and muse before she became a war correspondent who documented the aftermath of World War II.

title.children: Meet the woman who sat in Hitler's bath and inspired Kate Winslet's latest film

image.altText: Man loses his popcorn because he gets startled with fright

props.synopsis: From a twisted take on Freaky Friday to a deeply satisfying 'eat the rich' fable, here are some Halloween movies that might give you a jolt but won't keep you up at night.

title.children: Too scared to watch horror movies? Here are 5 to ease you into the genre

image.altText: Jad is at the front of a hidden cave, with a friend. He's not wearing a shirt, and swimming shorts.

props.synopsis: Lebanese people are coming together to help house and feed the 1.2 million displaced people in Lebanon, as the country marks 30 days of war. From Australia to the heart of Beirut, they're uniting together to help the country and its people.

title.children: Jad used to chase waterfalls in Lebanon. Now he's collecting donations to help 1.2 million displaced people
